verses.text: 他們走近耶路撒冷，到了伯法其和伯大尼，來到橄欖山那裡，耶穌派了兩個門徒，

words.note: Used before measure words instead of 二 (èr).

verses.text: 對他們說：「你們往對面的村子裡去，一進去，就會看見一頭小驢拴在那裡，是沒有人騎過的，把牠解開牽來。

words.note: Used in the '一...就...' structure to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Often pairs with '一 (yī)' for 'as soon as... then...'
Indicates a past experience.
Used to connect a modifying phrase to a noun.
Indicates the object is acted upon or disposed of.
Specific pronoun for animals; often written as 它 (tā) in general use.

verses.text: 如果有人問你們：『為甚麼這樣作？』你們就說：『主需要牠，並且很快會送還到這裡來。』」
門徒去了，就發現一頭小驢，拴在門外的街上，就把牠解開。
站在那裡的人有的問他們說：「你們為甚麼解牠？」

words.note: Connects a modifying phrase to a noun, forming 'the ones who were standing there'.
Here acting as a short form of '解開 (jiěkāi)'.

verses.text: 門徒照著耶穌所說的話回答他們，那些人就讓他們牽走了。

words.note: Lit. 'gate-follower' or 'one who enters the gate of learning'
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'that which was said'

verses.text: 門徒把小驢牽到耶穌那裡，把自己的衣服搭在上面，耶穌就騎了上去。
許多人把衣服鋪在路上，還有人從田野裡砍了些樹枝也鋪在路上。
前行後隨的人都喊著說：「『和散那』，奉主名來的是應當稱頌的！

words.note: Idiomatic phrase describing the crowd's movement
A Hebrew expression of adoration and appeal, meaning 'save now!'
Can mean 'to obey' or 'by command of', here 'in the name of'

verses.text: 那將要來臨的，我們祖先大衛的國是應當稱頌的！高天之上當唱『和散那』！」

words.note: Can mean country, but here refers to God's kingdom
Lit. 'high heaven'
之 is a classical possessive/linking particle

verses.text: 耶穌到了耶路撒冷，進入聖殿，察看了一切，因為時候已經不早，就和十二門徒出城往伯大尼去。

words.note: Here, '不早' means 'late'.

verses.text: 第二天他們從伯大尼出來，耶穌餓了。
verses.heading: Cursing of the Fig Tree

verses.text: 他遠遠看見一棵長滿了葉子的無花果樹，就走過去，看看是否可以在樹上找到甚麼。到了樹下，除了葉子甚麼也找不著，因為這不是收無花果的時候。

words.note: Repetition for emphasis.
Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree', referring to figs where flowers are internal.
Repetition indicates a brief or exploratory action.

verses.text: 耶穌對樹說：「永遠再沒有人吃你的果子了！」他的門徒也聽見了。
他們來到耶路撒冷。耶穌進了聖殿，就把殿裡作買賣的人趕走，又推倒找換銀錢的人的桌子，和賣鴿子的人的凳子；

words.note: Introduces object of action (ba-construction).

verses.heading: Cleansing the Temple

verses.text: 不許人拿著器皿穿過聖殿。

words.note: Often used for temple implements or pottery in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 他又教訓眾人說：「經上不是寫著『我的殿要稱為萬國禱告的殿』嗎？你們竟把它弄成賊窩了。」

words.note: Can also be a noun meaning 'teaching' or 'lesson'.
Refers to what is written in the Bible/scriptures.
A vivid, negative metaphor.

verses.text: 祭司長和經學家聽見了，就想辦法怎樣除掉耶穌，卻又怕他，因為群眾都希奇他的教訓。

words.note: Experts in Jewish law and scripture.

words.definition: think of a way, devise a plan

words.note: Similar to 稀奇, meaning 'to marvel at something unusual'.
Here used as a noun, referring to Jesus' teachings.

verses.text: 到了晚上，他們就到城外去。
早晨，他們經過的時候，看見那棵無花果樹連根都枯萎了。

words.note: Literally 'no-flower-fruit-tree', referring to the fig tree.

words.definition: even the roots, root and all

verses.heading: The Withered Fig Tree

verses.text: 彼得想起來就對耶穌說：「拉比，請看，你所咒詛的無花果樹，已經枯萎了。」

words.note: A Jewish title for a teacher of the Torah.
Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree'.

verses.text: 耶穌回答他們：「你們對 神要有信心（「你們對 神要有信心」有些抄本作「如果你們對 神有信心」）。

words.note: A reverential spacing for 'God' in many Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，無論甚麼人對這座山說『移開，投到海裡』，只要他心裡不懷疑，相信他所說的一定能夠成就，就必給他成就。
所以我告訴你們，凡是你們禱告祈求的，只要相信能夠得到，就必得到。

words.note: A V-O compound, common in biblical context.

verses.text: 你們站著禱告的時候，如果有誰得罪了你們，就該饒恕他，好使你們的天父也饒恕你們的過犯。」
（有些抄本有第26節：「如果你們不饒恕人，你們的天父也必不饒恕你們的過犯。」）

words.note: A common word in religious texts for forgiveness.
A common word in religious texts for forgiveness.
Commonly used in Christian theology for 'sin' or 'trespass'.

verses.text: 他們又來到耶路撒冷。耶穌在殿裡行走的時候，祭司長、經學家和長老來到他跟前，

words.note: Specifically refers to the Temple in Jerusalem in a biblical context.
Refers to Jewish scholars who interpreted the Mosaic law.
Refers to senior members of the community or religious leaders.

verses.text: 問他：「你憑甚麼權柄作這些事？誰給你權柄作這些事？」

words.note: Refers to legitimate power or authority.
Refers to legitimate power or authority.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「我要問你們一句話，你們回答了我，我就告訴你們我憑甚麼權柄作這些事。

words.note: Refers to legitimate power or authority.

verses.text: 約翰的洗禮是從天上來的，還是從人來的呢？你們回答我吧。」

words.note: Religious rite of initiation or purification.
Often refers to divine origin in religious contexts.

verses.text: 他們就彼此議論：「如果我們說『是從天上來的』，他就會說『那你們為甚麼不信他呢？』

words.note: Lit. 'that and this'
Contextually refers to divine origin.
Auxiliary verb indicating future or possibility.

verses.text: 如果我們說『是從人來的』……」他們害怕群眾，因為眾人都認為約翰的確是先知。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.text: 於是他們回答耶穌：「我們不知道。」耶穌對他們說：「我也不告訴你們我憑甚麼權柄作這些事。」
